title: Quetzalcoatl - author portrays Europeans as being

content.question: In the lines (“The enchanting places . . . had been subdued”), the author portrays Europeans as being

choices.label: skeptical of accounts about the Indies
apprehensive about contact with the Indies
eager for knowledge of the Indies
proud of having conquered peoples of the Indies

content.answer: eager for knowledge of the Indies

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Explain how word choice, comparisons, and syntax contribute to the specific tone or style of a text.
